section.4.title: Canonical Correlation and Covariates
section.4.text1: Based on these eigen-solutions, we define canonical covariates and canonical correlation coefficients.
section.4.def1.title: Canonical covariates
section.4.def1.text: The pair $(\alpha_i^\top\mathbf{X}, \beta_i^\top\mathbf{Y})$, $i=1,\ldots,\min(p,q)$, is called the $i$th pair of canonical variates.
section.4.def2.title: Canonical correlation coefficients
section.4.def2.text: The correlation $\rho_k$ ($k=1,\ldots,\min(p,q)$) is referred to as the $k$th canonical correlation coefficient between random vectors $\mathbf{X}$ and $\mathbf{Y}$.
